io.hekate.messaging

Interface MessageInterceptor<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - Base type fo messages that can be handled by this interceptor.

    public interface MessageInterceptor<T>
    Message interceptor.

    This interface can be registered to the messaging channel in order to intercept and transform messages.

    See Also:
    MessagingChannelConfig.setInterceptor(MessageInterceptor)

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  MessageInterceptor.InboundContext
      Context for interceptInbound(Object, InboundContext).
      static interface  MessageInterceptor.OutboundContext
      Context for interceptOutbound(Object, OutboundContext).
      static interface  MessageInterceptor.ReplyContext
      Context for interceptReply(Object, ReplyContext) .

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default T interceptInbound(T msg, MessageInterceptor.InboundContext ctx)
      Intercepts the inbound message.
      default T interceptOutbound(T msg, MessageInterceptor.OutboundContext ctx)
      Intercepts the outbound message.
      default T interceptReply(T msg, MessageInterceptor.ReplyContext ctx)

    • Method Detail

      • interceptOutbound

        default T interceptOutbound(T msg,
                            MessageInterceptor.OutboundContext ctx)
        Intercepts the outbound message.

        This method gets called by the MessagingChannel after the target node had been selected by the LoadBalancer for the specified outbound message. Implementations of this method can decide to transform the message into another message based on some criteria of the MessageInterceptor.OutboundContext.

        Parameters:
        msg - Message.
        ctx - Context.
        Returns:
        Transformed message or the original message if transformation is not required. Returning null will be interpreted as if no transformation had been applied and the original message should be send to the target node.

      • interceptInbound

        default T interceptInbound(T msg,
                           MessageInterceptor.InboundContext ctx)
        Intercepts the inbound message.
        Parameters:
        msg - Message.
        ctx - Context.
        Returns:
        Transformed message or the original message if transformation is not required. Returning null will be interpreted as if no transformation had been applied and the original message should be processed by the MessageReceiver.

      • interceptReply

        default T interceptReply(T msg,
                         MessageInterceptor.ReplyContext ctx)
        Intercepts the outbound reply.
        Parameters:
        msg - Message.
        ctx - Context.
        Returns:
        Transformed message or the original message if transformation is not required. Returning null will be interpreted as if no transformation had been applied and the original reply message should be sent.
        See Also:
        Message.reply(Object), Message.partialReply(Object)
